conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to follow the path of each colored liquid as it moves through the baffle system.
The baffles are placed in such a way that they create paths for the liquids to flow into containers E and F.
Each lettered point (A, B, C, D) represents the starting point of the liquids, and their colors match the lines in the diagram.
The green liquid from A appears to bend towards the left and flows into container E.
The orange liquid from B bends downward and flows into container F.
The yellow liquid from C bends to the right and flows into container F.
The blue liquid from D bends upward and flows into container F.
From the analysis, the liquids will flow into the containers as follows: Green liquid (A) goes into container E; Orange liquid (B), Yellow liquid (C), and Blue liquid (D) go into container F.
Green liquid (A) flows into container E; Orange liquid (B), Yellow liquid (C), and Blue liquid (D) all flow into container F.
